result.execSummary:
The defendant Andre P Brown was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Cocaine (>5-15g) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)2.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Consecutive to 14CF617 but concurrent with 15CF370.

superMiscConds.notes:
Def is not to consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances without a prescription from licensed physician, with random screenings.
.

Pay Crime Lab and Drug Assessment fee (see 'other' above for amount)

  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendent in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

  Pay DOC Supervision fees.

  Undergo any other assessments or evaluations deemed appropriate by PO and follow through with any treatment recommendations.
.

from Atty Sean O'Neill    re: Req that SEH set for 10-19-15 be cont'd at the Def's request.  Def understands it may take some time to reschedule.  There is no objection from DA's office

State by Hynek /  Def in custody w/ Atty Sean O'Neill
CRT:  Mr. O'Neill req continuance - I denied it because I wanted it addressed in open CRT
O'Neill:  my client would hope to resolve all charges...
Hynek:  Objects..I told Mr. O'Neill in writing on 6-5-15 that I would not consolidate the 2 cases - I am prepared for sentncing today.  He's req continuance after continuance & that led him to being arrested on new charges - object to continuance
CRT:  If I enter sentence today I would probably send him to prison & then he would have to be brought back....in interest of judicial economy it's better he wait - what is status of new case?
O'Neill:  we're not that far into case - just had the Prelim Hrg...
CRT:  Set this for trial (14CF617/14CF646) & give me a trial date I can work with.  It will soon be July - I will ask Cindy to find a Sentencing date in the Month of Sept., if [new case] not set for trial by Sept, I'll have the Sentencing first - he can go to prison & State will have to bring him back

from Atty Sean O'Neill   re: SEH set for 6-26-15.  Req Hrg be set out further because of def's current charges & O'Neill will be in trial this week.  Req date in Sept.
